questions.question: When a private citizen apprehends someone and hands them over to the police, what responsibilities does the receiving police personnel have, as stated in the Lock-up Administration Policy?

options.a: Only check for the validity of the apprehending party's identification.
options.b: Enquire into the circumstances, establish identity, collect statements, and carry out relevant police actions.
options.c: Do not collect any statements, just accept the person into custody.
options.d: Contact the apprehending party's lawyer immediately.

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). Traced back to section 8.3.2.

questions.question: What procedure is to be followed for the release of prisoners from police custody, as per the Lock-up Administration Policy?

options.b: Verify their identity only by checking their appearance.
options.c: Ensure positive identification is made before release by checking with the investigator, interviewing the prisoner, and examining physical characteristics.
options.d: Release prisoners without their personal property.

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to section 8.4.1.

questions.question: According to the Lock-up Administration Policy, what items should accompany a prisoner upon release to another lock-up or agency, provided they are not subject to police investigations?

options.a: None of the prisoner's personal property should accompany them.
options.c: All personal property of the prisoner.

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to section 8.4.2.

questions.question: What items are considered unauthorized and may be intercepted during the inspection of articles brought by visitors for prisoners in police custody, as mentioned in the Lock-up Administration Policy?

options.c: Cellular phones, glassware, matches, and drugs.
options.d: Any articles that are not on an approved list.

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to section 8.5.5.

questions.question: What measures are recommended in the Lock-up Administration Policy to minimize the opportunity for prisoners to escape from police lock-ups?

options.b: Allow prisoners to have access to the cell keys.
options.c: Implement security measures, such as not allowing single staff members to enter cells and locking unused doors.

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to section 8.6.1.

questions.question: What is the procedure for personnel wishing to gain access to the lock-up facilities, as outlined in the Lock-up Administration Policy?

options.a: Access is unrestricted; anyone can enter without permission.
options.b: Personnel must request permission from the Sub-officer in charge lock-ups.
options.c: Only the Custody Officer is allowed to enter lock-up facilities.
options.d: All personnel must be armed with firearms.

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). Traced back to section 8.6.3.

questions.question: According to the Lock-up Administration Policy, what responsibilities do the Sub-officer in charge lock-ups and the Station Guard have regarding the security of the cells and the safety and welfare of prisoners?

options.b: They must ensure that the prisoners are comfortable.
options.c: They are responsible for the security of the cells and the safety and welfare of all prisoners in custody.
options.d: Their only responsibility is to maintain cleanliness in the cells.

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to section 8.6.4.1.

questions.question: How often should prisoners be visually observed, according to the Lock-up Administration Policy?

options.b: At least once every half hour, or three times every hour between 7:00 p.m. and 5:00 a.m.
options.d: Only when requested by the prisoners.

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). Traced back to section 8.6.4.3.

questions.question: What is the purpose of regular security inspections of lock-up facilities, as mentioned in the Lock-up Administration Policy?

options.a: To assess the comfort of the prisoners.
options.c: To ensure the safety of police and prisoners and minimize the opportunity for escape.
options.d: To evaluate the quality of the food provided to prisoners.

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to section 8.6.2.15.

questions.question: According to the policy, how often should cells be thoroughly searched in addition to regular daily searches to prevent the discovery of contraband?
questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to section 8.6.5.1.
